description: The 2022 Candidates Tournament is an eight-player chess tournament, with the winner qualifying for the challenger's spot against the defending champion Magnus Carlsen in the World Chess Championship 2023. The double round robin tournament is scheduled to take place at the Palace of Santoña in Madrid, Spain from June 16 to July 5, 2022.

markets.description:
The 2022 Candidates Tournament is an upcoming eight-player chess tournament, with the winner qualifying for the challenger's spot against the defending champion Magnus Carlsen in the World Chess Championship 2023. The double round robin tournament is scheduled to take place at the Palace of Santoña in Madrid, Spain from June 16 to July 5, 2022. 

If Ding Liren wins the 2022 Candidates Tournament, this market will resolve to "Yes." Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

At any point if there is no path to victory for Ding Liren based on the format of the tournament, this market will resolve to "No".

If the determination of the winner is not made by July 31, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET, this market will resolve 50-50.

--

If there is a tie for first place, tie-breaks have following format:

Players play two rapid chess games at 15 minutes plus 10 seconds per move. In the case of a three-way to six-way tie, a single round-robin is played. If seven or eight players are tied, a single round-robin is played with a time limit of 10 minutes plus 5 seconds per move.

If any players are still tied for first after the rapid chess games, they play two blitz chess games at 3 minutes plus 2 seconds per move. In the case of more than two players tied, a single round-robin is played.

If any players are still tied for first after those blitz chess games, the remaining players play a knock-out blitz tournament at the same time control. In each mini-match of the knock-out tournament, the first player to win a game wins the mini-match.
markets.question: Chess: Will Ding Liren win the 2022 Candidates Tournament?

markets.description:
The 2022 Candidates Tournament is an eight-player chess tournament, with the winner qualifying for the challenger's spot against the defending champion Magnus Carlsen in the World Chess Championship 2023. The double round robin tournament is scheduled to take place at the Palace of Santoña in Madrid, Spain from June 16 to July 5, 2022.

This market asks whether Ding Liren or Ian Nepomniachtchi will finish higher in the 2022 Chess Candidates Tournament. If Ding Liren finishes it in a higher position than Ian Nepomniachtchi, this market will resolve to "Liren". If Ian Nepomniachtchi finishes it in a higher position than Ding Liren, this market will resolve to "Nepomniachtchi".

If it is clear at any point in the tournament that one of the players will finish higher than the other based on the format of the tournament, the market will resolve immediately. 

---

If there is a tie for first place, tie-breaks take the following format:

Players play two rapid chess games at 15 minutes plus 10 seconds per move. In the case of a three-way to six-way tie, a single round-robin is played. If seven or eight players are tied, a single round-robin is played with a time limit of 10 minutes plus 5 seconds per move. 

If any players are still tied for first after the rapid chess games, they play two blitz chess games at 3 minutes plus 2 seconds per move. In the case of more than two players tied, a single round-robin is played. If any players are still tied for first after those blitz chess games, the remaining players play a knock-out blitz tournament at the same time control. In each mini-match of the knock-out tournament, the first player to win a game wins the mini-match.  

Ties for places other than first are broken by, in order: (1) Sonneborn–Berger score; (2) total number of wins; (3) head-to-head score among tied players; (4) drawing of lots.
markets.question: 2022 Chess Candidates Tournament: Will Liren or Nepomniachtchi finish higher?
